messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/api/v1/media` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/MediaController.php`, `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\MediaController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/api/v1/media` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins" (I will split your output and then do json parse, so you must output it and do not change it), followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
The endpoint GET /api/v1/media is implemented in MediaController@index to return a paginated collection of media items. The only explicit request parameter used in this method is limit, which determines the page size for pagination with a default value of 20. There are no other required or optional parameters derived from the code shown. While Laravel's paginator also uses a page parameter internally, it is not explicitly handled in the controller, so it is not represented as a separate parameter here.

the final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "limit",
    "in": "query",
    "description": "Number of items per page for pagination. Defaults to 20.",
    "required": false,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int32",
    "minimum": 1,
    "default": 20
  }
]
